member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ServiceFabric.Module.CacheBasedOperationHolder`1.memoryCache
member.summary: The memory cache instance used to hold items. MemoryCache.Default is not used as it is shared across application and can potentially collide with customer application.

member.summary: The cache item policy which identifies the expiration time.

member.param: Identifier for the cache.
Expiration time in miliseconds.

member.summary: Gets the IOperationHolder object against the given key.
member.param: The request against which the operation holder is stored.
member.returns: The operation holder against the key. Null if not found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ServiceFabric.Module.CacheBasedOperationHolder`1.Remove(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.V2.IServiceRemotingRequestMessage)
member.summary: Removes the entry for the given request.
member.param: The request against which the operation holder is stored.
member.returns: True if able to remove, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ServiceFabric.Module.CacheBasedOperationHolder`1.Store(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.V2.IServiceRemotingRequestMessage,Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Extensibility.IOperationHolder{`0})
member.summary: Adds operationHold in MemoryCache. DO NOT call it for the request that already exists in the cache. This is a known Memory Cache race-condition issue when items with same id are added concurrently and MemoryCache leaks memory. It should be fixed sometime AFTER .NET 4.7.1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ServiceFabric.Module.ServiceRemotingHeaderUtilities.UpdateHeaderWithKeyValue(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given the provided list of header value strings, return a list of key name/value pairs with the provided keyName and keyValue. If the initial header value strings contains the key name, then the original key value should be replaced with the provided key value. If the initial header value strings don't contain the key name, then the key name/value pair should be added to the list and returned.
member.param: The existing header values that the key/value pair should be added to.
The name of the key to add.
The value of the key to add.
member.returns: The result of setting the provided key name/value pair into the provided headerValues.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ServiceFabric.Module.ServiceRemotingHeaderUtilities.GetHeaderKeyValue(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Get the key value from the provided HttpHeader value that is set up as a comma-separated list of key value pairs. Each key value pair is formatted like (key)=(value).
member.param: The header values that may contain key name/value pairs.
The name of the key value to find in the provided header values.
member.returns: The first key value, if it is found. If it is not found, then null.
